description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fdgp4","text":"The purpose of these two protocols combined is to improve the accuracy of genome assembly and gene expression analysis, especially when investigating the mechanisms of antibiotic resistance. Four samples are chosen including MSSA, MRSA, VSSA, and VRSA, with MSSA/VSSA acting as genomic controls and the other two samples acting as the antibiotic resistant genomes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apkka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alks7","text":"Long reads provide the ability to span large, complex, and repetitive regions of the genome, which is critical when identifying structural variations and fully assembling genomic regions like those harboring antibiotic resistance genes. Short reads, on the other hand, offer high base-level accuracy and depth, which is important for identifying small mutations or variants, such as SNPs or indels, that may contribute to antibiotic resistance or virulence.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"231uk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q2b4","text":"Once both sequencing runs are complete, a workflow aligning both kits results could reveal variations in resistance gene loci and differences in gene expression that influence pathogenicity, with short read sequencing filling in the gaps of information that long read sequencing may have left.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

image_attribution: {"blocks":[{"key":"dheqf","text":"This image identifies the workflow of first the Native Barcoding Kit, in which the samples are dA-tailed and end repaired prior to ligation, followed by the ligations of barcodes and adapters, then finally the cleanup of the DNA and sequencing. The second portion of the workflow represents the Nextera XT kit in which fresh samples are first tagmented, amplified, cleaned then loaded. steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"13cba","text":"Add 15 µl of resuspended AMPure XP Beads (AXP) to each end-prep reaction and mix by flicking the tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8a6d3","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for 5 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1gjt1","text":"Prepare sufficient fresh 80% ethanol in nuclease-free water for all of your samples. Allow enough for 400 µl per sample, with some excess. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ljtg","text":"Spin down the samples and pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless. Keep the tubes on the magnet and pipette off the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9s0qn","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with 200 µl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"49iiv","text":"Repeat the previous step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"438hd","text":"Briefly spin down and place the tubes back on the magnet for the beads to pellet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for 30 seconds, but do not dry the pellets to the point of cracking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"de2se","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 10 µl nuclease free water. Spin down and incubate for 2 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fndr2","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32n8l","text":"Remove and retain 10 µl of eluate into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube. Dispose of the pelleted beads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DNA Repair and End Prep (Native Barcoding Kit)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tfst","text":"Quantify 1 µl of each eluted sample using a Qubit fluorometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjoq4","text":"Prepare the NEB Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix according to the manufacturer's instructions, and place on ice: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"37phs","text":"Thaw the reagents at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"21fjr","text":"Spin down the reagent tubes for 5 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73gq","text":"Ensure the reagents are fully mixed by performing 10 full volume pipette mixes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"334hg","text":"Thaw the EDTA at room temperature and mix by vortexing. Then spin down and place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gumq","text":"Thaw the Native Barcodes (NB01-24) required for your number of samples at room temperature. Individually mix the barcodes by pipetting, spin down, and place them on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rha3","text":"Select a unique barcode for each sample to be run together on the same flow cell. Up to 24 samples can be barcoded and combined in one experiment. Please note: Only use one barcode per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fbr4","text":"In clean 0.2 ml PCR-tubes or a 96-well plate, add the reagents in the following order per well: Between each addition, pipette mix 10 - 20 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d7cl","text":"7.5ul of Reagent Volume ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7logm","text":"2.5ul of Native Barcode (NB01-24) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctiqt","text":"10ul of Blunt/TA Ligase Master","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg6vk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r90a","text":"Thoroughly mix the reaction by gently pipetting and briefly spinning down. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"33pob","text":"Incubate for 20 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3cadm","text":"Add the following volume of EDTA to each PCR tube or well and mix thoroughly ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kp4","text":"EDTA clear cap: 2ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qd8j","text":"EDTA blue cap: 4ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clbmt","text":"Pool all the barcoded samples in a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ctop","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfaq3","text":"Total Volume for preps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tiqk","text":"EDTA Clear Cap - 22ul,     For 6 samples: 132ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vff3","text":"EDTA Blue Cap - 24 ul,      For 6 samples: 144 ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t385","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7oi22","text":"Resuspend the AMPure XP Beads (AXP) by vortexing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ka96","text":"Add 0.4X AMPure XP Beads (AXP) to the pooled reaction, and mix by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3nra","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h9el","text":"Volume of AXP for preps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j2td","text":"EDTA Clear Cap - 9ul,  For 6 samples: 53ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djjrb","text":"EDTA Blue Cap - 10ul,  For 6 samples: 60ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"firrj","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for 10 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4tiqe","text":"Prepare 2 ml of fresh 80% ethanol in nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gn51","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet for 5 minutes. Keep the tube on the magnetic rack until the eluate is clear and colourless, and pipette off the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9elo5","text":"Keep the tube on the magnetic rack and wash the beads with 700 µl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2df59","text":"Repeat the previous step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12un5","text":"Spin down and place the tube back on the magnetic rack. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow the pellet to dry for ~30 seconds, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"192nt","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 35 µl nucleasefree water by gently flicking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"do81l","text":"Incubate for 10 minutes at 37°C. Every 2 minutes, agitate the sample by gently flicking for 10 seconds to encourage DNA elution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ppkr","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnetic rack until the eluate is clear and colourless.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9m774","text":"Remove and retain 35 µl of eluate into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"epb79","text":"Quantify 1ul of eluted sample using a Qubit fluorometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kdl3","text":"Prepare the NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Module according to the manufacturer's instructions, and place on ice:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3siiq","text":"Thaw the reagents at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fj1tf","text":"Spin down the reagent tubes for 5 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ca3fi","text":"Ensure the reagents are fully mixed by performing 10 full volume pipette mixes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4pp9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aaqr5","text":"Note: Do NOT vortex the Quick T4 DNA Ligase. The NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (5x) may have a little precipitate. Allow the mixture to come to room temperature and pipette the buffer up and down several times to break up the precipitate, followed by vortexing the tube for several seconds to ensure the reagent is thoroughly mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo9lj","text":"Spin down the Native Adapter (NA) and Quick T4 DNA Ligase, pipette mix and place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2pj1o","text":"Thaw the Elution Buffer (EB) at room temperature and mix by vortexing. Then spin down and place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foukr","text":"Thaw either Long Fragment Buffer (LFB) or Short Fragment Buffer (SFB) at room temperature and mix by vortexing. Then spin down and place on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek855","text":"In a 1.5 ml Eppendorf LoBind tube, mix in the following order","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9epn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90ufq","text":"30 ul of Reagent Volume Pooled barcoded sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7nl8","text":"5ul of Native Adapter (NA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ofk","text":"10ul of NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (5X)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbii9","text":"5ul of Quick T4 DNA Ligase","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6n2df","text":"For a total volume of 50ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3f8oj","text":"Thoroughly mix the reaction by gently pipetting and briefly spinning down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cbp8k","text":"Incubate the reaction for 20 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"92pee","text":"Resuspend the AMPure XP Beads (AXP) by vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"apr5f","text":"Add 20 µl of resuspended AMPure XP Beads (AXP) to the reaction and mix by pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9o03q","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89dho","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on the magnetic rack. Keep the tube on the magnet and pipette off the supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82apn","text":"Wash the beads by adding either 125 μl Long Fragment Buffer (LFB) or Short Fragment Buffer (SFB). Flick the beads to resuspend, spin down, then return the tube to the magnetic rack and allow the beads to pellet. Remove the supernatant using a pipette and discard. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b4ro2","text":"Repeat the previous step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"686r3","text":"Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ebeo9","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 15 µl Elution Buffer (EB). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pkuo","text":"Spin down and incubate for 10 minutes at 37°C. Every 2 minutes, agitate the sample by gently flicking for 10 seconds to encourage DNA elution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"datsf","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colourless, for at least 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"526c5","text":"Remove and retain 15 µl of eluate containing the DNA library into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11hv6","text":"Depending on your DNA library fragment size, prepare your final library in 12 µl of Elution Buffer (EB). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"560ia","text":"Fragment library length:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38rt6","text":"Flow cell loading amount: Very short (\u003c1 kb) 100 fmol ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8gk","text":"Short (1-10 kb) 35–50 fmol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17nea","text":" Long (\u003e10 kb) 300 ng","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfdv8","text":"The purpose of the lysis addition and modification is due to the thickness of Staphylococcus aureus's cell wall. In order to achiever desired results for the following library kits, samples should have high molecular weight DNA, the only way to achieve this is by lysing the cells using lysostaphin. Lysostaphin ensures the cells are lysed efficiently for gDNA isolation (whereas normal gram-negative techniques will not have).  Quantification is used to ensure successful lysis and the ability to proceed onto extraction and library prep. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctfm4","text":"Loading should be done on a MinION flow cell according to these protocols (Ligation sequencing gDNA - Native Barcoding Kit 24 V14 (SQK-NBD114.24) (NBE_9169_v114_revR_15Sep2022) (nanoporetech.com) and sequencing should be done on a GridION device. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":120}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CC017A3081BE11EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://nanoporetech.com/document/ligation-sequencing-gdna-native-barcoding-v14-sqk-nbd114-24?device=GridION"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v26m","text":"Run 1 µl undiluted library on an Agilent Technology 2100 Bioanalyzer using a High Sensitivity DNA kit.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asc5n","text":"Typical libraries show a broad size distribution of ~250–1000 bp, as shown in the top panel. Various libraries can be sequenced with average fragment sizes as small as 250 bp or as large as 1500 bp.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bdhn","text":"This section is to troubleshoot library size and concentration inconsistencies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6efua","text":"Checking Library Size:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rjj8","text":"Larger molecules cluster less efficiently than smaller molecules. If the fragment size after tagmentation is larger than expected, low cluster numbers are possible. The inverse is also true. The average expected library size after tagmentation is between 400 bp and 1.2 kb.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50cnk","text":"Check the library size with a high sensitivity Bioanalyzer trace after the PCR cleanup step. Look for a long low plateau. Alternatively, PCR-amplify the library with qPCR primers and run the product on an agarose gel. The sequence for these primers is available in the Sequencing Library qPCR Quantification Guide (document # 11322363).","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6ca6","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uvp6","text":"Short libraries indicate too little input DNA: Requantify the input DNA with a fluorometric method. Start with 10%–25% more input DNA. If the library peak is below 400 bp and you want to continue with this library, dilute the library further.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1uet","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k4hh","text":"Long libraries indicate too much input DNA or inhibitor presence: Start with less input DNA, make sure that the input DNA is free from inhibitors, and repeat the quantification step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fgss","text":"Check library concentration: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s488","text":"Bead-based normalization is most efficient when the library yield after amplification is 10–15 nM, or higher. Measure library concentration using high sensitivity dsDNA Qubit after library cleanup, and measure library size with a Bioanalyzer to calculate molarity.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"312vs","text":"If you are starting with high-quality DNA and see low yield after library cleanup, there are possible issues with IPB cleanup or the amplification step. If results show either condition, confirm proper storage of the PCR master mix at ‑25°C to ‑15°C in a no-frost freezer. Confirm minimal freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ic0l","text":"This step normalizes the quantity of each library made with Nextera XT Index v2 or Nextera XT Index Kits to ensure more equal library representation in the pooled library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vm2h","text":"Place on the magnetic stand and wait until the liquid is clear (~2 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo9fd","text":"Transfer 30 µl supernatant from each well of the MIDI plate to the corresponding well of the SGP plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cs4de","text":"Seal the sample plate, and then centrifuge at 1000 × g for 1 minute. At this point, the libraries are single-stranded DNA, which resolves poorly on an agarose gel or Bioanalyzer chip. For quality control, use the double-stranded DNA saved from step 17 of the cleanup procedure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3r04","text":"Load libraries according to loading protocols for the MiSeq platform.  (https://support.illumina.com/content/dam/illumina-support/documents/documentation/system_documentation/miseq/miseq-system-guide-15027617-06.pdf). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":143}],"data":{}},{"key":"9gj2","text":"Sequencing setting sshould be set to paired end reads and a target of 30x-100x coverage. {"blocks":[{"key":"4f8ov","text":"This sections fragments and tags DNA with adaptor sequences. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
